name: London
hint: Capital of the United Kingdom, home to Big Ben and Buckingham Palace

name: Paris
hint: Capital of France, known as the City of Light

name: Berlin
hint: Capital of Germany, once divided by a famous wall

name: Rome
hint: Capital of Italy, the Eternal City with ancient ruins

name: Madrid
hint: Capital of Spain, located in the center of the Iberian Peninsula

name: Amsterdam
hint: Capital of the Netherlands, famous for its canals and tulips

name: Vienna
hint: Capital of Austria, historic center of the Habsburg Empire

name: Prague
hint: Capital of the Czech Republic, known as the City of a Hundred Spires

name: Stockholm
hint: Capital of Sweden, spread across 14 islands

name: Athens
hint: Capital of Greece, birthplace of democracy and the Acropolis

name: Lisbon
hint: Capital of Portugal, built on seven hills along the Tagus River

name: Warsaw
hint: Capital of Poland, rebuilt after extensive WWII destruction

name: Moscow
hint: Capital of Russia, home to the Kremlin and Red Square

name: Copenhagen
hint: Capital of Denmark, known for Tivoli Gardens and the Little Mermaid statue

name: Dublin
hint: Capital of Ireland, famous for its literary history and Georgian architecture

name: Oslo
hint: Capital of Norway, situated at the head of a fjord

name: Helsinki
hint: Capital of Finland, a Baltic Sea port known for design and architecture

name: Budapest
hint: Capital of Hungary, formed by uniting Buda and Pest on opposite banks of the Danube

name: Bucharest
hint: Capital of Romania, nicknamed Little Paris for its elegant Belle Epoque buildings

name: Brussels
hint: Capital of Belgium and de facto capital of the European Union

name: Edinburgh
hint: Capital of Scotland, famous for its medieval Old Town and annual Fringe Festival

name: Porto
hint: Portugal's second city, birthplace of port wine along the Douro River

name: Barcelona
hint: Spain's Mediterranean gem, home to Gaudi's Sagrada Familia

name: Valencia
hint: Spain's third-largest city, birthplace of paella and the City of Arts and Sciences

name: Milan
hint: Italy's fashion and finance capital, home to the famous Duomo cathedral

name: Florence
hint: Birthplace of the Renaissance, home to Michelangelo's David and the Uffizi Gallery

name: Naples
hint: Southern Italian city near Vesuvius and Pompeii, birthplace of pizza

name: Munich
hint: Bavarian capital famous for Oktoberfest, beer gardens, and BMW headquarters

name: Hamburg
hint: Germany's second-largest city, a major port with the famous Speicherstadt warehouse district

name: Frankfurt
hint: Germany's financial hub, home to the European Central Bank and a famous skyline

name: Zurich
hint: Switzerland's largest city, a global banking center on the shores of Lake Zurich

name: Geneva
hint: Swiss city hosting many UN agencies, on the shores of Lake Geneva near Mont Blanc

name: Antwerp
hint: Belgium's diamond capital and second city, a major port on the River Scheldt

name: Lyon
hint: France's gastronomic capital, at the confluence of the Rhone and Saone rivers

name: Marseille
hint: France's oldest and second-largest city, a vibrant Mediterranean port

name: Krakow
hint: Poland's cultural capital, home to Wawel Castle and a stunning medieval Old Town

name: Gdansk
hint: Polish Baltic port where WWII began and the Solidarity movement was born

name: Bratislava
hint: Capital of Slovakia, a compact old town on the Danube near the Austrian border

name: Ljubljana
hint: Charming capital of Slovenia, known for its dragon bridge and green city center

name: Zagreb
hint: Capital of Croatia, a Habsburg-era city with a vibrant cafe culture

name: Dubrovnik
hint: Walled Croatian coastal city, famously used as King's Landing in Game of Thrones

name: Thessaloniki
hint: Greece's second city, a vibrant port with Byzantine walls and the White Tower

name: Tallinn
hint: Capital of Estonia, a medieval walled city and digital innovation hub on the Baltic

name: Vilnius
hint: Capital of Lithuania, known for its baroque Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Riga
hint: Capital of Latvia, famous for its Art Nouveau architecture and medieval old center

name: St. Petersburg
hint: Russia's cultural capital, home to the Hermitage Museum and white summer nights

name: Venice
hint: Italian city built on 118 islands connected by canals and gondolas

name: Reykjavik
hint: World's northernmost capital, gateway to Iceland's geysers and northern lights

name: Belgrade
hint: Capital of Serbia, at the confluence of the Danube and Sava rivers

name: Sarajevo
hint: Capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, where the assassination that triggered WWI occurred
